net.hudup.core.client

Class SocketWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.client.ProtocolImpl
      • net.hudup.core.client.SocketWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, Protocol, Service
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SocketConnection

    public class SocketWrapper
extends ProtocolImpl
implements Service
    This class implements the Service interface according to socket connection in order to send request to server and then receive response (result) from server. SocketWrapper is really a service when its implemented methods focus on providing recommendation, inserting, updating and getting information such as user ratings, user profiles, and item profiles stored in database. SocketWrapper can send/receive only one request/response to/from server at one time. So every time users want to send/receive request/response to/from server, they must re-create a new instance of SocketWrapper.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • estimate

        public RatingVector estimate(RecommendParam param,
                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> queryIds)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Serve to estimate rating values of specified querying identifiers (IDs). Such IDs can be user IDs or item IDs. Method estimate(...) of Recommender class is responsible to do estimation task really.
        Specified by:
        estimate in interface Service
        Parameters:
        param - specified recommendation parameter represented by RecommendParam. Recommendation parameter contains important information as follows:
        • Initial rating vector which can be user rating vector or item rating vector.
        • A profile which can be user profile containing user information (ID, name, etc.) or item profile containing item information (ID, name, price, etc.).
        • A context list relevant to how and where user (s) rates (rate) on item (s).
        • Additional information must be serializable.
        Note, rating vector represented RatingVector contains ratings. If rating vector is user rating vector, it contains all ratings of the same user on many items. If rating vector is item rating vector, it contains all ratings of many users on the same item.
        queryIds - specified set of identifiers (IDs). Such IDs can be user IDs or item IDs.
        Returns:
        rating vector containing ratings of specified IDs.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • recommend

        public RatingVector recommend(RecommendParam param,
                              int maxRecommend)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Serve to produce a list of recommended items based on specified recommendation parameter and the specified maximum number of recommended items.
        Specified by:
        recommend in interface Service
        Parameters:
        param - specified recommendation parameter represented by RecommendParam. Recommendation parameter contains important information as follows:
        • Initial rating vector which can be user rating vector or item rating vector.
        • A profile which can be user profile containing user information (ID, name, etc.) or item profile containing item information (ID, name, price, etc.).
        • A context list relevant to how and where user (s) rates (rate) on item (s).
        • Additional information must be serializable.
        Note, rating vector represented RatingVector contains ratings. If rating vector is user rating vector, it contains all ratings of the same user on many items. If rating vector is item rating vector, it contains all ratings of many users on the same item.
        maxRecommend - specified maximum number of recommended items.
        Returns:
        rating vector represented by RatingVector, which contains recommended items together their estimated rating values.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

        @Deprecated
public Recommendlet recommend(java.lang.String listenerHost,
                                           int listenerPort,
                                           java.lang.String regName,
                                           java.io.Serializable externalUserId,
                                           java.io.Serializable externalItemId,
                                           int maxRecommend,
                                           Rating rating)
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Serve to generate a recommendlet, based on many input parameters. Recommendlet represented by Recommendlet class is a service or a small graphic user interface (GUI) that allows users to see and interact with a list of recommended items. Recommendlet is now deprecated.
        Specified by:
        recommend in interface Service
        Parameters:
        listenerHost - specified listener host.
        listenerPort - specified listener port.
        regName - registered name of recommendlet.
        externalUserId - specified external user identifier (user ID).
        externalItemId - specified external item identifier (item ID).
        maxRecommend - the maximum number of recommended items.
        rating - rating value for updating.
        Returns:
        recommendlet represented by Recommendlet class is a service or a small graphic user interface (GUI) that allows users to see and interact with a list of recommended items.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getUserAttributeList

        public AttributeList getUserAttributeList()
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Getting attribute list of user profiles. Note, attribute list contains many attributes. Attribute represented by Attribute class indicates the data type, which is also a wrapper of data type. Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses attribute to specify its data types and so profile owns a reference to an attribute list. Please see AttributeList class for details about attribute list. All profiles of users share the same attribute list.
        Specified by:
        getUserAttributeList in interface Service
        Returns:
        attribute list of user profiles, represented by AttributeList.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

        public ExternalRecord getUserExternalRecord(int userId)
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Getting external record of a given user by her/his identifier (user ID). Note, external record represented by ExternalRecord class is a record (a row in table) which is stored in other database (different from the framework database). It is opposite to internal record represented by InternalRecord class which is a record stored in the framework database.
        Specified by:
        getUserExternalRecord in interface Service
        Parameters:
        userId - specified user identifier (user ID).
        Returns:
        external record of a given user by her/his identifier (user ID).

      • getItemProfiles

        public Fetcher<Profile> getItemProfiles()
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Getting profiles of items. These profiles are retrieved via fetcher. Note, profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file). Fetcher is the interface for iterating each element of an associated collection.
        Specified by:
        getItemProfiles in interface Service
        Returns:
        Fetcher of item profiles.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getItemAttributeList

        public AttributeList getItemAttributeList()
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Getting attribute list of items. Note, attribute list contains many attributes. Attribute represented by Attribute class indicates the data type, which is also a wrapper of data type. Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses attribute to specify its data types and so profile owns a reference to an attribute list. Note, all item profiles in framework database share the same attribute list. Please see AttributeList class for details about attribute list.
        Specified by:
        getItemAttributeList in interface Service
        Returns:
        attribute list of items.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

        public ExternalRecord getItemExternalRecord(int itemId)
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Getting external record of a specified item. Note, external record represented by ExternalRecord class is a record (a row in table) which is stored in other database (different from the framework database). It is opposite to internal record represented by InternalRecord class which is a record stored in the framework database.
        Specified by:
        getItemExternalRecord in interface Service
        Parameters:
        itemId - specified item identifier (item ID).
        Returns:
        external record of a specified item.

      • getNominal

        public NominalList getNominal(java.lang.String unitName,
                              java.lang.String attribute)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Getting nominal list by specified unit and attribute. Nominal list is a list of many nominal (s), specified by NominalList. Nominal data indicates discrete and non-number data such as weekdays {Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday}. Nominal data is called nominal, in brief, represented by Nominal class. Unit represents a CSV file, database table, Excel sheet, etc. Unit is used to store object such as user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc. Attribute represented by Attribute class indicates the data type, which is also a wrapper of data type. If unit is database table, an attribute is identical to a field.
        Specified by:
        getNominal in interface Service
        Parameters:
        unitName - specified unit name.
        attribute - specified attribute name.
        Returns:
        nominal list by specified unit and attribute.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getServerConfig

        public DataConfig getServerConfig()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Hudup server owns a configuration which includes some server information such as server port, the period in miliseconds that the Hudup server does periodically internal tasks. This method retrieves such server configuration.
        Specified by:
        getServerConfig in interface Service
        Returns:
        configuration of Hudup server, represented by DataConfig.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getSessionAttribute

        public java.lang.String getSessionAttribute(java.lang.String attribute)
        Retrieving an attribute having the specified name of the current session in server. Hudup server (recommendation server) serves all incoming request in a time interval (a period in mili-seconds). Such time interval is called session. Each session has a number of attributes. Each attribute is a pair of key and value. Key is also called name. When it is time-out which means that the server has received no request after the time interval then, the session is destroyed, which causes that all attributes are destroyed.
        Parameters:
        attribute - specified attribute name.
        Returns:
        text value of the attribute having the specified name of the current session in server.

      • getSnapshot

        public Snapshot getSnapshot()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Retrieving an image of dataset owned by Hudup server at current time point. Such image is snapshot stored in memory. Snapshot is represented by Snapshot class.
        Specified by:
        getSnapshot in interface Service
        Returns:
        Snapshot of dataset owned by Hudup server at current time point.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • sendQuitRequest

        public void sendQuitRequest()
        Sending the quit request to server. Quit request is the one that requires server to quit, which means that server will be stopped and removed from memory.

      • sendRequest

        protected Response sendRequest(Request request)
        Sending a request to server and waiting for receiving the response from server. This method is called by most of methods to serve incoming request.
        Parameters:
        request - specified request.
        Returns:
        Response received from server.
